Reviews.Title: “Great Introduction to Rome”
Reviews.Author: ajay78
Reviews.Content: Thanks to the super-friendly and wonderful staff of the Imperiale, my first trip to Rome got off to the best possible start. They made us feel completely at home and yes, service came with a genuine smile. The room was large and decorated well and we had a wonderful view of the Via Veneto. The location is also very convenient with the hotel being just a 5-minute walk from the Barberini station. And finally, they had a fabulous breakfast spread.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location!!”
Reviews.Author: NikosTo
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately when arriving at the hotel I realized that they had kept my room . A few minutes later and after after several times apologized for their mistake offered me a coffee and a car picked me up and transferred me to the Hotel Donna Laura at the other site Of Rome near to saint Pietre . There, after I explained what happened in Imperiale gave me a room when I opened the door I realized that there was no sheets no pillows. Having lost my patience now descend again in the lobby And asks them to find me a room you can stay, then the girl of the reception desk (Katerina) decided to send me to a regular room. The next day and after the breakfast I asked to send me back to Imperiale, When I arrived left my luggage and took the metro to the Coliseum. 3 hours later and after returning to the hotel, waiting me a pleasant surprise they gave me a better room than what I had booked and a plate of fresh fruit waiting for me. My impressions of the hotel is quite good, the location of HELPS VERY someone who wants to browse the Rome. The metro stop “Barberini” is only 70 meters from where you can quickly move into the city's greatest attractions. The staff is very helpful and polite especially the staff of the Breakfast, Room 311 that I had is clean and in a perfect condition the only minus is the noise from via Veneto, Finaly after all this bad things I recommend this hotel if you ever planed to visiting Rome, I will returned for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Rather 'Fawlty Towers' on this visit”
Reviews.Author: BoardmanMijas_Spain
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two years ago with a big group of friends whilst over to see the 6 nations rugby and the group chose to come here again. I didn't rate it highly then but combined with the renovations (of which we had no prior notice), it's now like Fawlty Towers. The reception area is shut for renovation so the little bar area is reception......and the bar!! My friend and I had booked a twin room but got a double which they had to convert whilst we were out. 10 minutes later whilst in the bar to get two glasses of wine which took five minutes as the waiter had to go outside into the street somewhere to get a bottle, I heard three complaints about the heating and two about the fact that the wifi wasn't working. The next morning we had great fun at breakfast watching the staffs reaction to the lift breaking down (which set off lots of alarms), which meant all the guests had to walk back through the breakfast room and up the back stairs to get to their rooms. The next day two of our party wanted to check in online and we tried to use the computer in 'reception' about 10 paces from, and in full view of the two staff on the desk. After at least 10 minutes of failing to get anywhere it seemed to switch off and we were concerned maybe we' d caused it to crash. Not to worry the receptionists happily informed us......it's not working anyway!!! Almost worth it for it laugh factor alone.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: OntarioViking
Reviews.Content: The four of us (My wife, Sister, Brother-in-law and myself) spent one night here after our 14 day cruise. It was one of very few hotels that offered a quad room. We had our shuttle driver drop us at the hotel by 10 am they day our cruise ship docked. Check-in was fast and their English was very good. We had to take turns riding the elevator with all our luggage (basically a 2 person elevator). The room was large with a Queensize bed plus 2 fold out sleeper chairs - very comfortable. The front desk showed us the best way to see Rome in a day & a half. Hop-on Hop-off bus - caught it just on the other side of the Piazza. We spent the day touring the city then finally back to the hotel for dinner. We ate in the separate glassed in dining room in front of the hotel (on the very wide sidewalk) excellent food and very reasonably priced. We all slept like logs that night after all the walking we did. Rome proper is not that big- easily walkable if you are somewhat fit. I will go back to Hotel Imperiale the next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joseph V
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly staff. You can walk to all the cultural sites

Reviews.Title: “Perfect would highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sharry101
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, clean rooms great staff and tasty breakfast even brought us fresh coffee on a very busy pressurised weekend.

Reviews.Title: “September 2010-Bad experience with hotel staff and management”
Reviews.Author: hector C
Reviews.Content: All clients of this hotel should be informed the hotel is located within the Zone Traffic Limited (ZTL) area of Rome. So if you are driving a rented car it is a potential to receive a fine for a traffic violation since you don't have the proper Police authorization to do so. Upon your arrival, the Hotel has the obligation to call the Municipal Police of Rome and provide to them your car license plate. Of course, the hotel staff didn't inform the police the LP # neither us about this regulation and I received a fined for Euros 99.88 a month ago. They cannot argue they din't know I was driving the car because they arranged with the parking lot they are working with to pick up our car. I'm still dealing with the Rome's police to see if they drop the charge because it was not our fault. To fight the fine I need the Hotel receipt that I hasn't anymore with me. I asked to the Hotel to provide a copy about 3 weeks ago and they ignored me and didn't answer any of the other 2 more e-mails I sent them, These people don't know the meaning of "Customer Services". The travel was last year but I selected September 2011 just to allow me to submit the appraisal

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DorianneMalta_Europe
Reviews.Content: Cosy, clean room, good breakfast but above all excellent location to see Rome on foot. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: rff1001
Reviews.Content: Great Location, Standard european midrange hotel... I would stay here again for the location.

Reviews.Title: “A Rip Off!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HabanaMadrid
Reviews.Content: Definitely would not recommend this hotel. Very expensive. Very basic room. Old furniture. Horrible decoration. Extremely small bathroom (could not open the door entirely), and very, very poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Spanish steps and short taxi ride from main train station with clean functional rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Sranstice
Reviews.Content: There is some construction happening so check the exact location of your room or be happy to wake early. Breakfast was only average, everything else is good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: Marianne182
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here recently for three nights and loved it!! (22/9/2011) The receptionists were very friendly and courteous. The room was small but beautifully decorated. There were a lot of people staying there but it was so quiet, hard to believe we were in the middle of Rome. The hotel is very comfortable and excellently maintained. There is also a lovely little hotel bar as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel - poor service”
Reviews.Author: scand3388
Reviews.Content: On the plus side - elegant hotel in a wonderful location. Great location on the trendy Via Veneto street, close to everything, metro station is right outside the hotel. You can pretty much walk to all the sites from this hotel - 5 minute walk to Spanish Steps, 5 minute walk to Trevi Fountain and the Pantheon. The low point by far was the breakfast.. It is horrible and impersonal. Breakfast coffee was AWFUL - just machine "poison", and the breakfast fruit juice tasted like chemical machine juice, very poor for a 4star hotel. Service is erratic (depends who you get and whether they are in a good mood - can be really helpful if you are lucky) and the breakfast is, well, strange even for Italy. No coffee making facility in the room. We were unlucky as there was a large construction noise from the yard side, and the poor and expensive internet access didn't work as it was supposed to. Staff were not especially welcoming, they could have been a bit more friendly. They should greet customers as they enter or exit. Just unpleasant. Some more efficiency, some more smiles and things could have been so much better.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location in Rome, service is average, but great value overall”
Reviews.Author: robfromVancouver
Reviews.Content: I read some of the other reviews on Trip Advisor before booking, so was taking a real gamble in my mind. But the price on Expedia was not to be passed up. The hotel location is absolutelty fantastic on many levels. If you are arriving at the Termini on an airport transfer, its only 2 stops to Baberini on the Linea A, and the hotel itself is about 100 yards from the Baberini station exit (Via Veneto exit). As for sights, you can walk to any of the major sights in Rome in under 30 minutes. The trevi fountain and Spanish steps are a 10 min walk. The Pantheon on Colesseum about 25 mins and the Vatican City about 35 mins. Within this range as well are hundreds of restaurants (not all good though! see some reviews I did on those). So the location couldn't be beat in my eyes. The rooms are pretty average European hotel rooms - yes, slightly on the small side, but not horrible. I spent a bit of time in the room too, ending up having to do some work whilst there, and I never found it claustrophobic. The rooms were good quality and very clean. The bed was slightly hard, but again pretty standard for a European hotel. The included breakfast is good and lots of choice. Though annoyingly stops at 10 am - which if you are having a lie in the morning can make you feel rushed!! The service is as everyone says on here....extremely rude front desk staff. They are horrific and above all condesending. This is not typical Italian service, which can be a bit rude to begin with. Any question I had was responded to with as if I should have known the answer. And, to top it off when I asked them about booking a taxi to Fiumucino Airport, they said a taxi would cost 50 euros. Now, the standard rate to/from central Rome and FCO is 40 euros. This is a standard, legal tariff. So, I suspected the deskman was taking a 10 euro kick back from the driver. I ended up booking a Mercedes E-Class(!!) through Click Airport Transfer (www.clickairporttransfer.com) for 45 euros. Was a much nicer way to get to the airport. Minor points - safe in room didn't work, they tried to fix it but couldn't so I had no where to put valuables, and the internet is 7 euros per day, about 90% of hotels now have free wi-fi...it amazes me ones that don't in 2011!!

Reviews.Title: “Great - apart from the service”
Reviews.Author: Samserena
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and didnt expect much from the staff but even so was amazed at their rudeness and how unhelpful they were. When it comes to the rooms you get more than you pay for and the location is good for the termini, the restaurant is nice also. But honestly the staff are just unimaginably rude.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Magnus B
Reviews.Content: We had a problem with our booking. I booked a room for four but when we arrived the booking was for three. The staff was extremely rude as if it was my fault and didn't give us any room until 4 hours after check-in. We then got a room for three. Well a double room with an extra travel bed. When I complained to Expedia after the trip the hotel lied about the room we were given. They claimed the room was for four. See picture ... Very unfriendly staff, elevator didn't work most of the time, staff didn't know how to start the juice machine at breakfast, the toaster didn't work, they charged 6 euro for a 2 euro water bottle etc. Don't, just don't.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but it's not 4 stars hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Laleto
Reviews.Content: Great location in the center of Rome, easily reachable by public transport, especially metro. The Hall is comfortable and has a beautiful dining room, but breakfast is very poor! My room was small and not very clean but the staff is very helpful. after eating (bad) in some restaurants of Via Veneto, we asked a suggestion to the Night Porter Andrea, who has recommended us the restaurant "Il Tempio di Minerva" in Viale Manzoni typical Italian restaurant with a very charming atmosphere and the price-quality ratio is excellent; the owner of the restaurant is a class person and very kind, and paid us a taxi to return in hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Missing property from our room”
Reviews.Author: shump99
Reviews.Content: Dear Management of the Hotel Imperiale, This letter is to document the property missing from our room and the lack of response from the hotel staff concerning this issue. My wife and I have stayed at your hotel in the past and enjoyed it so much we decided to return again this time. We travel extensively both domestically and internationally and have never had any of our personal items lost, stolen, or removed from any room we have ever stayed in. We stayed at your hotel in room 203 from June 6 to June 10, 2011. On June 9th at 12:00 we left our room for the day. We came back around 5PM. As we were getting dressed for dinner my wife noticed her Calvin Klein makeup bag missing. This item was in the room 5 hours earlier because my wife had used it. The bag contained makeup items and cash. We searched the room extensively and could not find the bag. The bag was left on the desk where it had been for the past 2 days. We also noticed that our bottle of wine that we had left in the refrigerator was now sitting on top of our desk and another bottle of wine in the fridge had been disturbed. I reported the item missing to the front deskman at 6PM and asked that he call housekeeping and look into this issue for us. When we returned from dinner at 11PM the new deskman had no information for us. The following morning we left your hotel at 7:30 for a scheduled train and left a note requesting the management of the hotel contact us concerning this issue. I am now back in the United States and have heard nothing from anyone in your hotel concerning our missing property. I am prepared to file a claim with your hotel. Please inform me of the procedure to do so. Thank you. Sincerely, Ed The above letter was emailed on Date: Tue, 14 Jun 2011 To: <info@hotelimperialeroma.it> Subject: Missing Property During our stay On 6/23/11 6:41 AM, "Hotel Imperiale" <info@hotelimperialeroma.it> wrote: Dear ED First of all we would like to thank you for the preference according us and we are sorry for the trouble happened during your stay. As already informed at your departure by the staff on duty , unfortunately ,we do not know nothing about your bags that has been lost All your bags have been taken and brought down at the reception. In room we found no other items left Otherwise all our staff is trustworthy and works with us for a long time and we have never received such abnormal experienced Best regards HOTEL IMPERIALE 2011/6/23 Ed >: I see the response but this does not address my issue. Did you check your computer key card system to see who went into my room between 12:00 and 17:00 on June 9? Someone came into my room during those hours and removed my property. The value of the lost property I have recalculated to $250. Please submit a reimbursement request to your insurance company or credit my credit card. Thank you Ed Dear Sir Ed with reference to your request we would like to inform you that to open practice with our Insurance we need to receive your statement from a Police Station looking forward to hearing from you best regards Gaetano Lombardi Hotel Imperiale

Reviews.Title: “UNSAFE”
Reviews.Author: Hanaa71
Reviews.Content: I got robbed inside the hotel lobby while settling my account before check out. Hotel staff were totally indifferrent and uncooperative and refused to call the police despite my calls for help. The hotel has no surveillance cameras inside its lobby and provided no assistance whatsoever although I had lost my travel documents in the incident.

Reviews.Title: “Worst meal ever! Walked out.”
Reviews.Author: traveltromp
Reviews.Content: Walked by and thought the gazebo restaurant in front had nice menu and ambiance. We ordered a starter each, beef carpaccio and a tortelini soup. The carpaccio came out FULLY COOKED and CHEWY! The soup was suppose to be excellent according to waiter but was literally cooked tortolini in a bowl of HOT WATER with ZERO taste, not even salt! No exaggeration. We called the waiter over to say this was not at all meeting any expectations but he made no effort to offer alternatives or explanations. We were so disgusted we left 5 euros for the water and walked out on the rest of the meal.

Reviews.Title: “Awful hotel. Put a downer on my trip.”
Reviews.Author: Heatherneedsaholiday
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very over priced, has horribly rude staff and the smallest, most uncomfortable room I have ever stayed in! The walls aren't sound-proofed so you may as well be sleeping in the hallway. The jacuzzi is 15euros to use and the hotel restaurant is the biggest rip-off going. Rome is my favourite city in the world and I have stayed in many different hotels but this was definitely the worst. It put a downer on my weekend trip. There are hundreds of other hotels in Rome, find another decent one which is not such bad value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location”
Reviews.Author: gde3333
Reviews.Content: We were a small group visiting Rome for 3 days and we could not have been happier then we were with our choice of Hotel Imperiale on Via Veneto. The staff at the desk, in the kitchen and bellmen went out of their way to make us feel welcome and to answer any questions that we had. Mr. Joseph, the conseigere, was right on with his suggestions of where to go and what to see. He also helped with securing taxi's for 24 people which was no small task. The boss, Gaetano, was very professional in helping with our reservations and went out of his way to be sure our group was pleased with the hotel. He even arranged to have the breakfast staff come in early on our departure day to be sure we had coffee and breakfast before our 7:00 am departure. Hotel Imperiale will be our choice when we return to Rome in 2 years. Thanks to all for your professionalism. Gary Eldridge eeTours

Reviews.Title: “It was in the center and close to many shop.”
Reviews.Author: jeff68Berlin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great position, very clean, the rooms are comfortable and stuff very helpful and kind. I would definitely recommend it and of course I would go there again. The hotel should provide wi-fi access free of charge. It is not professional to charge it for 7 Euros per day and not to have access from the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room...great service...convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JimandAndreaG
Reviews.Content: Arrived early morning after flight from U.S.A. well before room was supposed to be ready. Staff suggested we have breakfast at the breakfast buffet while we waited in advance of checking in and at no additional cost. The courtesy was very much appreciated after the long flight. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful with directions and suggestions during our stay. Room was on the small side but stylish and quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Just had a dinner in their restaurant but...”
Reviews.Author: Bonaqua
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a ladies weekend in Rome. Usually we followed food advises in our Times Out guidebook but on the last evening, we just wanted to eat nearby so we passed by Hotel Imperiale and saw their street restaurant and it looked fine for a meal.. Thus we had a "antipasti della mare" with the note "if no fresh seafood available, then frozen seafood will be served". We asked the waiter if it was fresh or frozen, and he clarified it was fresh. So we had a plate of.. hmm.. frozen.. calamari and a few defrosted shrimps and shells on some.. hmm... lettuce. That was followed by a pasta amatriciana. Which was pasta (not even al dente but thoroughly cooked! In Italia! Mama mia!). The sauce consisted of 50% cheap olive oil, 49% tomatoes and 1% very mysterious fatty meat or bacon perhaps. Big portion - so yummy - NOT. We could not even be bothered to look at the dessert menu or order an espresso. EUR 79 in total - sharing this antipasti starter, 2 pastas and half a bottle rather cheap wine. I am not a chef myself, but I cook 10 times better than this myself (at least, 20 probably). I still have nightmares about this meat / bacon. Yuck! On their home page it funnily says "The kitchen serves traditional dishes that together with the care and imagination of the chef will make the experience absolutely unforgettable, all accompanied by superb wines from our cellar". I see, I see ;)

Reviews.Title: “Location was good, close to shops and attractions.”
Reviews.Author: MurrayOne_11
Reviews.Content: Old but very clean room,friendlystaff who were very helpful. The Hotel is clean, quiet and very central, walking distance to almost all attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Awful breakfast , too hot in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: irmos
Reviews.Content: Location is very convenient , 10 min to Spanish steps, but we were staying during New Year eve , the hotel was full, there were queue to the breakfast room, only two staff members were there. There were no plates for 10 minutes. We were trying twice but then decided to go the nearest caffe. It was too hot in the rooms, we ask concierge to do something with air-condition, but nobody came. We paid 315€ for such service , I think it's does not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: oslo90
Reviews.Content: Clean room with all comforts. Very good location, 5 minutes walk from Spanish steps and Villa borghese.

Reviews.Title: “Hey, its a room in Rome”
Reviews.Author: davenorris
Reviews.Content: The Imperiale is located in a nice part of Rome and is convenient to many of the must see attractions. It is clean and the staff are pleasant. It is however expensive for what you get,even if you are in the heart of Rome. And what do you get? Well, a small room, maybe tiny is the better word, on a noisy street (I guess they all are in Rome) with very little ambiance. Maybe this is typical of most hotels in major cities in Europe. Not the best value from my perspective...

Reviews.Title: “Serious cleaning issues”
Reviews.Author: Alemarchini
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location, near from the Metro Station, located in a very well-known avenue from the City - wich is Via Veneto, but as nothing is for free you pay too much for being well located. But the most serious issue I had was with the cleaning from my room, the cleaning is not carefully done, it is actually far from being in the avarege, for a hotel like this it is inacceptable what happen with me, dirty floor with a lot of hair and dust, dirty bathroom and another critical problem I can`t write in here. And also my bed was broken. Anyway, you can find options much better for better price. Terrible experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget the earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: Zhopa
Reviews.Content: The international organisation that I visit in Rome regularly books me into the Imperiale, and I wish they wouldn't. If it happens to you, make sure you ask for a room looking onto the courtyard, in order to avoid the 5 a.m. alarm call from the delivery truck in the back street that the other reviewers have mentioned! This time I was psychologically prepared for that, but not for the half-hour street party that followed... If you want to sleep, this hotel is a gamble. The rooms are a generous size (mostly), and it looks plush, but the fittings are tired and old (this time I was in room 121, and the shower was broken so you have to crouch like an ape to get wet while water sprays in all directions, and the water was luke-warm then eventually cold.) Service is erratic (depends who you get and whether they are in a good mood - can be really helpful if you are lucky) and the breakfast is, well, strange even for Italy. The bar charges 7.50 euro for a small bottle of local beer. I was charged a corporate rate of 130 euro a night for a single room. For that money, there has to be somewhere decent where you can actually sleep all night!

Reviews.Title: “affordable elegance in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Rabbit2011
Reviews.Content: Traveling solo? If you want a beautiful, elegant hotel in a wonderful location, try the Hotel Imperiale. Just a matter of a few blocks from Piazza Barberini, the Spanish Steps and any choice of public transportation to explore Rome. The interior is elegant, quiet and on the small side. My room was beautiful, just spacious enough with a big full marble bathroom. There is a complimentary continental breakfast served in the dining room. They have room service and a bar but no other meals are available. Just step out the door and multiple Italian cafe's are open for lunch, dinner and more. Feel safe and enjoy the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: nazolin
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend of mine and I stayed here for 4 nights. Everything about this hotel was great. Great location on the trendy Via Veneto street, close to everything, metro station is right outside the hotel. You can pretty much walk to all the sites from this hotel . 5 minute walk to Spanish steps, 5 minute walk to Trevi fountain and the Pantheon,.. There is also a great little restaurant on top the stairs by the hotel. The Breakfast was decent and the room was very clean and nice with a good size shower. We enjoyed it a lot.

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE LET ME SLEEP!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leonardo_Barbagallo
Reviews.Content: I could not believe that on a Monday night you can't sleep!! I was stressed and tired from a long day (waking up at 4 am to travel and a full day's work) only to find that I could not sleep in this place. I had room 316, which on appearances looks nice, only to find that it holds a dark secret......it doesn't let you sleep! I don't think I was rude in any way to the receptionist....but maybe he had a bad day, otherwise why would he have put me in that room? The first problem occurred in the evening while I was trying to fall asleep, on the street below there must be a pub, bar, club, or whatever that played extremely loud music until 12:30 in the morning (on a Monday night!!!), and the windows, even shut, do not keep the noise out at all and I'm one that normally sleeps through earthquakes. I then thought.....finally, I can get some rest.....only to find myself in the middle of my second problem......less than 5 hours later when a delivery truck decided to show up on the street below and start unloading using a very noisy, and what could only be described as a screaming mechanism gagging for WD40. The back of the truck used a loading tail which operated on a mechanisim to unload lots of steel cages of towels and other linen (presumably for the hotel I was staying at) over the infamous cobble streets of Rome......SMART! No consideration at all for guests! Replace the windows with double glazing would be the first solution, and secondly, don't have deliveries at such hours of the morning, let your guests sleep! Oh, and the breakfast is horrible and impersonal!!! Go next door to the Hotel Alexandra and in comparison its like being in heaven!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location/skip the breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: puddytat1
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here at the end of our lovely ten day vacation. We had a room on the third floor facing the back side street and the sound of a delivery truck at 5 am was horrendous and echoed in the narrow street. Get a room as high up as possible; this is a large city. Excellent location for walking to food, sites, Trevi fountain etc. Room (#218) was large with high ceilings, updated marble bathroom and very clean. European hotels are usually only going to offer separately installed a.c. units, small bath tub/showers & bare floors or area rugs. Hotel lobby and areas are clean and renovated. Front desk was superb with advice, varied languages and prompt attention. The large breakfast buffet has something for everyone except the coffee, which is strangely dispensed from self serve automatic machines. In Italy??

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Pink0213
Reviews.Content: People at the front desk were very rude. I have to say twice Hello to the front desk for him to say something back. Very unpleasant people. The shower was nasty. I could not wait to leave that Hotel. After staying in a great Hotel ( Royal Magda in Paris and Giorgione in Venice ) we had the horrible experience of staying in a Hotel where the front desk would not smile. Room service horrible asked for a towel it took probably 30 minutes after calling twice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: deaCork
Reviews.Content: What can I say! Stuck in rome for an extra 3 night due to the volcano. On checking out after our stay asked the staff could we come back if we didnt have a flight and they said we could have our rome at the same rate if we had to. We returned that night to the same room the staff at this hotel are fantastic especially Fabio, Andrea and Mr Joseph the concierge. If you are going to rome you have to stay at this hotel walking distance to spanish steps, trevi fountain, via del corso and 50m from metro stop.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: anni21
Reviews.Content: We had a very short stay in Rome before continuing on our trip, so we were glad to be in a nice, convenient location. The hotel was was great in all the important factors... clean, convenient, safe area and friendly staff .. and included breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Functional but pricey”
Reviews.Author: BoardmanMijas_Spain
Reviews.Content: On the plus side the location is central but the room ( two of us shared 116), was tired and small, e.g. mirror was blurred and didn't reflect, fading decor, etc. The bathroom was all basin and one had to move around sideways. As to the staff, the reception staff made no impression whilst the waiting staff were harrassed and indifferent at best. The outside back street to our room doubled as a noisy childrens palyground on Sunday morning. We were only there two nights so it wasn't a disaster but I would have been very disappointed if this had been my holiday accomodation for more than a weekend break. The low point by far was the breakfast. OK they seemed busy but one very slow coffee machine between all (100 or more covers?) was ridiculous. In any event the coffee tasted so much like tepid, sached, pre sugered cappuchino that everyone was ordering coffee 'from the kitchen' ?!. (Although I heard others say that after the long wait for it, this wasn't any better). Sparkling water was a problem (judging by the look on the waiter's face when I ordered it and the length of time it took to appear), but the 'biscuit' went to the only hot food, the 'scrambled eggs'. Warm reconstituted cardboard would have been a more appropriate description. I have truly never tasted such awful 'scrambled eggs'. A word of warning don't go to the cafe outside to the right immediately past the Alex. We made the mistake of bypassing the hotel and going there day 2. It was absolutely revolting, completely nuked and stone cold!

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: McGb
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel highly, some noted that the price is on the expensive side, maybe the case but its the location that seals this, from the Termini to to the hotel in a taxi costs circa €7.00 & also took in a Lazio game with tickets easy enough to pick up in official stores near the hotel. Non touristy restaurants located nearby and trevi fountain only a 5 min walk approx. Staff were very helpful & accomadating, Breakfast has the main essentials and is well presented.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location but small room”
Reviews.Author: VillaDS
Reviews.Content: We were transferred to this hotel due to our original hotel (Veneto Roma) having no room for us on arrival. The room on the 4th floor was very small and the decor rather dated although the bathroom was clean and modern. Room was at the back of the hotel - nice and quiet although no view of note. The reception staff were friendly and welcoming. Breakfast quality and choice was good. Good location (metro 50 metres) and Spanish Steps less than 10 minutes walk. Good restaurants nearby and nice pavement cafe next door.

Reviews.Title: “needs an interior facelift”
Reviews.Author: happycouple090
Reviews.Content: We spent our last night in Rome at this hotel on the Via Vittorio Veneto. Must say that we were a little disappointed about the interior. The decor of the rooms were very shabby and there was mildew around the shower in the ensuite. Our room was also very noisy.We also thought that 7euros to use the internet was a bit extreme seeing as we only used it for less than half an hour.Any other hotel where we stayed in italy during this time offered it for free. I must compliment the beauty therapist in the hotels beauty salon for giving me a great massage. Please update the hotel decor itself and look at what you are charging for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected for a 4 star hotel; very basic, we only slept there.”
Reviews.Author: keenwhit
Reviews.Content: Room, very basic; clean & large. Location is greatly. A/C severly lacking. Couldn't open window due to road noise, i.e. grating on road outside bldg. No bureau or dresser, couldn't unpack and had to live out of suitcases. Bed EXTREMELY firm. No clock in room, 19" TV. They really should add towel racks or clothing hooks in bathrooms. Front day desk clerk wouldn't exchange money, but evening clerk would. Due to early tour pick ups, they really should start breakfast before 7AM. If you book "hop on, hop off" tour, DON'T book thru hotel. Go to nearest stop and book thru rep. at that location. We would have saved @ 12 euro's.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, almost perfect but a bit pricey”
Reviews.Author: neuvoja
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in late August 2009. The location is great: close to major attractions and Metro. We had a large room and were able to check in early. The breakfast was excellent and the concierge, Mr. Joseph was most helpful (unfortunately he worked only afternoons). On the minus side: - EUR133 per night is a bit too much as this is no luxury hotel - The bathroom was spacious and had a Jacuzzi tub, but the extensive mildew on the moldings and tiles made me afraid to use it. The room was otherwise clean. - There is only one small elevator in this old building. During a brief failure we were happy to live only one flight up.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: Spinneygirl
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at this hotel by accident as there was a problem with the one I booked! Rooms were clean, although on the small side. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Location was excellent all attractions were in walking distance - 10 mins to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps! Would receommend "Citysightseeing Tour" 18 euros for 1 day ticket and it takes you everywhere! Also stop 2 mins from Hotel! Breakfast was good, lots of choice. I would return to this hotel again just for the location!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, staff polite but on the defensive and unaccomodating”
Reviews.Author: PrinnyP
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and my room was very nice except that it backed on some noisy street so got woken up early. Breakfast was adequate but no great shakes. The staff were polite but not accommodating. I needed an iron and they would not provide one (Italian law apparently) which is OK but for a 4 star hotel, I would expect someone to be there to iron. The staff including the so called duty manager made me feel as if I was asking something ridiculous. Not quite the attitude you would expect from a 4 star hotel. It puts off being able to recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “wouldnt go again at this hotel - overcharged for what they offer.”
Reviews.Author: eyedoctorfromRhodes
Reviews.Content: we stayed at our honeymoon. staff was excellent but the hotel was not as good. the rooms are very small , about 3mx3.5m size. clean but the bed was making some noise. we paid 295 euros per room , per night, and we believe that we paid a lot for what the hotel was able to offer us !!!!! so small rooms, breakfast only few things, but the location was excellent. with this money we could have stayed in a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but overpriced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: ppdm123
Reviews.Content: We stayed with my husband for 3 nights in June. The hotel is definitively well located, like other reviews here say, however, I thought it was way overpriced for what we got. There are other small hotels very close to this one, that might have better service and are as well located. We got a room with an A/C that must have been installed in the 70's and we had a phone in our room with no numbers.... The rooms were small and cramped. I did not like the service either, the staff at reception were not very helpful or well informed about what was going on in the city. I did not like it, as you can see.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: 3happytravelers
Reviews.Content: We checked into this hotel after taking a tour of Rome and saw the lovely Via Veneto, land of La Dolce Vita. It is one of the real triples, where the twin bed for 11-year old son was in a separate seating area, with a large curtain to separate the rooms. Bedroom was very nice and bathroom too. They should work a bit on the breakfast and the coffee, I had the only bad coffee (from a coffee urn) I have ever had in Italy!! We loved the restaurant outside the hotel -- for dinner an drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel overpriced, staff very rude.”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaArizonan
Reviews.Content: The first day our shower was plugged, second day the drain under the sink leaked all over the floor. They forgot our wake up call 2 different days almost causing us to miss our tour and our plane home. Would not recommend. Have traveled the world extensively and this is definately not a 4 star hotel for Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - Will definately be back”
Reviews.Author: skippy007Ireland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely, the staff are friendly and the rooms are large and clean. We arrived by 11am and there was no problem checking into our room straight away, so that we could get out and check out the city. The hotel is very close to the metro and within easy walking distance of the Trevi Fountain. The breakfast were really nice and had something for everyone, even though breakfast finishes at 10am the staff were refilling the buffet at 9.55!

Reviews.Title: “Good enough......”
Reviews.Author: Anathon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated well i Rome. Easy to go to most of the famous places, easy to reach the Metro, get a taxi and easy to go to the bus-trips around the city. If you have rooms out against the street you must expect some noise. The rooms in the front are, to our opinion, some small. No good chair to rest in. BUT, DO NOT book your stay when Venezuelan girls on there yearly rountrip i Europe stay in the hotel. There are not disiplin, and it seems that the reception or the girs leaders do not care if the girls are keeping the other guests awake most of the night. Sorry about that, but it looked more like a kindergarden than i four-star hotel!! Otherwise the service was good , and the restaurant service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome, customer service #1”
Reviews.Author: ValerieandMark
Reviews.Content: I cannot express enough how much we loved this hotel. The customer service was THE BEST we have had in a long time, and for our entire trip which consisted of 3 different hotels in Rome, Florence, and Sorrento. My parents raved about the Imperiale and that was almost 40 years ago, and most of our friends only stay there when in Rome. Roberto, Joseph, Almerica and the entire staff were always on hand to help us out. Roberto went out of his way months ago to email me about making arrangements for a papal audience and actually doing the legwork for me, emailing me several times with options and updates. We booked the audience through Vastours (watch out for them) and they FORGOT to pick us up on the morning of the audience! The bus had already left and I was left devastated and crying at the front desk because it ruined my reason for going there and my once in a lifetime opportunity to see the Pope. Almerica went into action so quickly, got into an argument with the Vastours person in the lobby for what they did to us and summoned a cab immediately to take us there. The cab got to the hotel in about 1 minute! We made it in enough time to see the Pope. On our way to Sorrento from Rome after checking out, we couldn't take the bus and called the Imperiale to arrange for a driver well after we checked out and were at Tiburtina bus station. Again, Almerica made the arrangements and a driver showed up in 20 minutes. We stayed there again on our last night from Florence to Rome to get the flight to JFK, and once again the staff went out of their way and also gave us a free upgraded room. The only downside, if there is one, is that the beds are pretty simple and apparently not great for back problem sufferers. They are two twin beds pushed together. I didn't mind it at all, but a larger person or someone with back problems might. We also gave each reception clerk a small tip because it was so well deserved, and they all didn't want to take it and were so gracious to us.

Reviews.Title: “Staff need customer service training”
Reviews.Author: Gill056
Reviews.Content: We were in a quad so actually the room size was adequate. I don't think it was worth the money; however, the location was ideal! We found the staff to be very rude and not helpful at all. We would often pass by the reception area without anyone greeting us. The staff just simply couldn't be bothered. I always felt that I was putting the staff out if I called from the room with a question. As reported many times, the breakfast definitely needed improvement. The orange juice tasted like Tang; the coffee was probably the worst I have ever tasted. Milk was too warm for cereal. The staff again seemed uninterested in looking after their customers. The rooms and the linen were very clean. I don't think I would go back. Management really needs to take a look at the front line staff. They have no idea as to how to provide good customer service. They do not seem interested in repeat business!!

Reviews.Title: “perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Andrea68_8
Reviews.Content: A friend who lives in Rome and works in the tourist industry recommended this hotel. I was a bit nervous because Trip Advisor had old reviews that weren't that great, but I'm so glad we decided to try it. It was perfect!! The people at the front desk were very nice, helpful, and spoke english well enough. The location was perfect for walking, but was also very close to the Metro. The Hotel is located on Via Veneto where the movie "Dolce Vita" was filmed. It was a beautiful area, clean, safe and quiet. The room was big and clean. The rate includes a full American buffet breakfast. I highly recommend this Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: Tony034
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for my business, I go very often to Rome, a city a really love. Usually I like find hotel in down town, close to Via Veneto (La dolce vita). This hotel is nothing special, but it is in very good position, not too far from the most important monument and intresting place, very good for me because I have to run a lot... the breakfast was ok, the room was clean but the service is not friendly. The doorman book for me a restaurant twice: Alex Café and Rossini. Alex is nice place in Via Veneto, good quality of service but the food doesn't taste. Rossini is the wrost restaurant I ate ever!!! It Is no italians work inside, only africans and romanian! They serve only junk food for tourist and the prices of the outside menus are different inside. If you don't understand yet, I love eat the good food. Anyway, the last day I found by myself, a very good family restaurant: Ristorante Barberini. It is behind the hotel, I had a great meals and service, the prices was "true" and the owner is an incredibile funny cute man. Such as a living monument for Piazza Barberini. So, if you need essential hotel in a good position, Hotel Imperiale is the place for you, but don't trust in the doormen. Anthony

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: chrisovitsanosa
Reviews.Content: Imperiale is the best hotel I ever stayed. Very good choice. Near to metro. It's located on high class area of Rome. Very good rooms and breakfast. It's very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: NYHilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Imperiale October 6-10 2007, it was a good hotel! The location is right on the historic Via Veneto, and it has a lot to see right within walking distance. Just up the block is Villa Borghase, amazing museum-book ahead- and down the block is piazza Barbirini, stop in at this great little wine shop just around the corner-Enoteca Vino VIP- from the hotel just head towards Barbarini, at the corner go right almost to the end and you'll find it- the girl that works in there is GREAT, we were there every day for water, soda, and of course wine to bring home. The hotel is RIGHT off the A line of the metro, which made going to major stops really nice and saved the feet a little, there are also bus stops on both sides of the streets, both public and tourist (I think it was 16E per person for a 24 hour pass and that goes EVERY where, just hop on and off) The Imperiale was clean and the staff was friendly, for Romans, the rooms were a good size, the only problem we had was that our room was hot- rather than complain and one of "those" Americans, we just opened the windows...it cooled things down and the traffic noise wasn't toooo bad. Over all a good stay, it does have internet for the cheapest we found in our hotels, 5E/hour, and the breakfast was typical European fare, the hotel resturant was right outside and had good food and wine. We would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “CHEATERS and ROBBERS”
Reviews.Author: pamalleg
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Imperiale has a staff and management that build their business on robbing their customers. Be sure that when you book this hotel and need to cancel, you will never be able to. The management will tell you that it was not done in the proper way or that they did not receive it via the proper website (although they did receive it) and ultimately charge you full price for rooms you had cancelled more than the required 24 hour notice. I stayed at the hotel for one night but was charged for 2 rooms for two nights. Can you imagine paying almost $800 for one night for one person? This was my welcome to Rome, Italy. Thank God I found some other hotels who were far better and fair about this. DON"T EVER STAY AT THE IMPERIALE because they will cheat you and the front desk people lie like a rug.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, shame about the food”
Reviews.Author: KATHYMLondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Rome before, so knew that any of the rooms in Rome would not be overly large. I took my friend for her first trip to Rome. The hotel is in a great location, just 5 minutes from the Spanish Steps and walkable to the Vatican. If you are intending to visit, your best bet is to stay on the Via Veneto because of the location, although hotels can be a bit pricey here. The staff were friendly and helpful and you will find on the reception desk there are "rip off" maps that you can take with you for sightseeing, very useful, especially if you don't want to take your guide book with you. A bit worried about the breakfast, as I had read some negative reviews, but tend to agree with the negative comments made in relation to breakfast as it did leave a lot to be desired. If you did want any (omelette/scrambled) egg (which usually was not hot) then you had to keep on reminding the waiters (when they did show up) which was not very often. I would not class this hotel as a 4* more a 3*. Our room was great though because it was at the back and very quiet, very clean and the bathroom was small with a shower. BUT must say that it was nice to get back to a quiet room after a hectic day's sightseeing (we had Room 121). If you do stay at this hotel, the location is great, but breakfast leaves a lot to be desired. We dined in the hotel's gazebo restaurant, and found this was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Awful staff”
Reviews.Author: grumpythewarthog
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 4.30pm the room was not ready we assured it would be ready in 15 minutes, we had to wait 90 minutes! The room was tiny we had to creep around the bed. The reception staff were rude and unhelpful all the time, only the concierge Mr Joseph was polite or friendly. and the porter. The breakfast was disgusting, watery juice or squash, coffee was tasteless, rolls and bread disgusting. There were no staff available to help in the breakfast room. The restaurant on the other hand was excellent, both the food first class and the staff, they were friendly and helpful. This hotel ruined our stay in Rome completely, to call it four star is an insult to hotels worldwide. The reception staff obviously missed the course on customer relations and service. A smile is a wonderful thing and it was lacking here.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Hotel a good Haven”
Reviews.Author: Antonio75
Reviews.Content: Returned from Imperiale after knowledge of some negative reviews.My impression was this Hotel is a comfortable haven after the bustle of Rome.The room was small but comfortable and the bathroom marble with a good bath/shower. No complaints there. The bar and lounge was also sufficient for a quiet drink but expensive ( as is London) . The comments on breakfast are well judged as this was a total disappointment both in quality and produce.However this aspect did not detract from the hotel overall which was clean and friendly. I would use local restaurants which are plentiful in the vicinity rather than the hotel restaurant. It is in a good area for Rome shopping and transport and taxis are in the nearby square 100 metres away. So no major concerns as it is the wonderful city that overrides everything

Reviews.Title: “post Christmas break”
Reviews.Author: strumble
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights arriving Boxing Day.We had stayed at this hotel before(5 years ago) and had been impressed.We requested the same room but on arrival were told that it was not available.We were given a very small room overlooking the Via Veneto.Apart from the room size we were happy - clean, nicely furnished, jacuzzi bath.Road noise did not bother us at all due to electronic shutters, double glazing etc.Heavy double doors to corridor meant we heard no guest noise either - good considering the hotel appeared to be full. Many people have commented on the standard of breakfast. We agree with those who give it a poor rating.We have stayed in many 4 star hotels across Europe and the Imperiale offering is one of the poorest.The orange juice was incredibly sweet cordial, there was only one salt pot for the entire restaurant leading to the farcical situation of the waiter spending most of his time wandering round tables looking for it! Although there were several waiters on duty they failed to notice when things needed replenishing.Having said that, breakfast is not the reason for visiting this magnificent city and the Imperiale is extremely well placed for sightseeing . This outweighs any negatives and we would stay here on a return visit. Avoid the gazebo restaurant belonging to the Imperiale -food very average and expensive. Try the restaurant by the metro station( turn right out of hotel 30 seconds walk) where you can watch the chef cooking pizzas through a large window .Pizzas excellent ,steak one of best we've had anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Traditional Style Hote in Good Positionl”
Reviews.Author: milverton
Reviews.Content: Very traditional style hotel . Situated well for visiting sights particularly Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps. Good position also for metro and bus access. We requested a room at the back of the hotel which they obliged,and it was great,quiet (amazing for Rome) spacious,and very clean and well maintained. The room and reception service was very good and helpful. We felt that the hotel for a 4 star let itself down on a couple of counts. 1 Breakfast totally self service with no inter-reaction with quests,served in a rather depressing room with no atmosphere.The breakfast was average. 2 The bar, lounge reception area again for a 4 star hotel was depressing and not a place you would want to sit have a drink and unwind after walking around Rome all day. As a base for sight seeing its a okay Regards Melvyn and Anne Dunn

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Mediocre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GATFW
Reviews.Content: On the upside this hotel is a short walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps, and right next to Barberini Metro. It's on a trendy, busy street with lots of restaurants. On the downside, the room we had was small, but pleasant. However the bathroom was in poor condition and ridiculously small, we are not large people, which is just as well because anyone carrying a few extra pounds would really struggle in such a small space. The breakfast wasn't very good (but it was our first time to Italy, so maybe that's normal). Summary: a great location for a short stay in Rome, but I've stayed in a great many 4 star hotels that are much better. There's nothing desperately wrong with the Imperiale, it just doesn't feel 4 star (but the prices do!).

Reviews.Title: “Great location, poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsHead
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Imperiale for the first part of our honeymoon and while the location was excellent the hotel was poor. We arrived at around 10.30pm on the first night and the staff barely acknowledged us, just gave us the room key and that was it. We had a very small room which we did consider asking to be changed but as we were hardly in the hotel we thought we wouldn't bother. The breakfat was below average, only the tall Italian version of Manuel made it worthwhile! One evening we returned to get changed for dinner to find that the toilet wouldn't flush, I contacted reception and they sent a doorman to look, he didn't know what was wrong so said they would get back to me. Over an hour later I went back to reception and they offered me a single room which they would put another single bed into - this room was tiny and we had no intention of spending any of our honeymoon in single beds. We had to argue with the staff for over 10 mins before they would offer anything better, they wanted us to stay in the room until a plumber came the next day! In the end we had a room the same size as the one we were already in and didn't get any apology for the trouble. Overall the hotel wasn't terrible but there must be better hotels in Rome for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Unprofessional hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeanster
Reviews.Content: We had an initial disappointment when we arrived at this hotel. The receptionist basically lied to us, she initially said they had overbooked then said they had a hydraulics problem which affected an entire floor of the hotel and some patrons (including myself and my husband) had to go to another hotel for one night. Ok, they paid for the taxi to and from the other hotel, but it meant we couldn't just unpack and settle in for a further day. The other hotel was also not situated in the city centre. When we did return the older man at reception told us "they had overbooked and too many people used the computer, not the way to work". That said, it was a lovely hotel in an ideal location for exploring the city centre. The Metro was nearby and there were plenty of restaurants to choose from. They did compensate for the inconvenience of us having to go to another hotel and gave us a junior suite with a jacuzzi which was spacious and comforatble. The staff were pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was fine, it could have been better but we thought it was fine, there was plenty of it and just what you would expect for a continental breakfast. We enjoyed our stay very much, apart from having to move initially. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't take the cat...”
Reviews.Author: 99Boxster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Imperiale on the second leg of our honeymoon. The location was fine - just 5 mins from the nearest Metro and walking dstance to Spanish Steps and Trevi fountain. The hotel itself was not so good. The room was barely ten feet square, with not enough space to have both cases open at same time and the cold buffet breakfast was terrible - even the orange juice wasn't fresh. So when in Rome, find the Imperiale, and then stay at one of it's many neighbours.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Price”
Reviews.Author: EmerG
Reviews.Content: We had a four night stay in August at Hotel Imperiale. Before arriving I had requested a quiet room away from the front of the hotel by email. However we were given a very small and noisy room at the front of the hotel. Having complained to the staff they organised for us to be moved the next day, we could not be moved that night as there were lots of teenage students staying that night. The room we were moved to was ideal and the air conditioning and jacussi were ideal in the August heat. The staff were always friendly and very helpful. The location is excellent, close to the metro and bus stops. Very near the trevi fountain and spanish steps. There are several good restuarants in the vicinity, from posh eateries to cheap places for lunch. Definatley would not recommend the hotel restuarant, it was overpriced for the quality of the food, in comparison to others nearby. Overall an excellent hotel and very good staff, would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: grapkin45
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a three night stay at Hotel Imperiale. Location is absolutely terrific - convenient to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, shopping, restaurants, metro and bus lines. Price was reasonable at less than 200E per night for prime location. Rooms were clean, comfortable, quiet and a good size. Found the staff to be friendly and extremely helpful in changing room arrangements and helping us plan special activities for the family. All in all, we found this a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Location-location-location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our arrival was early morning, before room was ready. Helpful staff placed luggage in locked room while we walked to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. The 110 bus stops right across street from hotel. The 110 is a great way for overview of city, with English speaking headphones to point out major attrractions as it circles the city. Room was charming, comfortable, quiet. Staff was very friendly and efficient; good breakfast, and overall, was good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “location is great”
Reviews.Author: eldadov
Reviews.Content: hotel imperiale has great location for sight seeing of rome. its postion allow us to take a nap each noon, in order to refresh for second course of rome at afternoon and evening. staff were very kind and helpful, they arraged early check-in, taxis, directions, and quick answers by email before our stay. the hotel public areas and the room were very clean and very fresh scented. our room (104) was large enough, but bathroom small (no bath, just congested shower). another con is that room was facing street, so a little bit noisy (also can hear noise from adjacent room). would surely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: minx6469
Reviews.Content: Not sure why some people didn't like this hotel. The room was spacious and clean. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was very nice. Location was great to catch a bus or the metro. Plenty of restaurants and cafes within walking distance. Really couldn't have asked for better.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay !”
Reviews.Author: sameZoetermeer
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay of 4 nights in the Imperiale. Despite several very negative comments we decided to go for it and had a very pleasant time. Location: 10 minutes walk from Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps. A bit further from Colloseum, Pantheon and Vatican, but the metro will take you there in no time. Room: we had no. 195, which was spacious enough, bathroom a bit small, but I had similar size bathrooms in Greece. For American standards everything might be small, but for Europe this is normal. Jacuzzi was very nice after long days of walking. Fresh towels every day and everything clean. Beds comfortable and we had no problem with A/C, room was cool enough, though it was very warm outside! Staff: friendly and very helpfull, do not understand the other reviews about the rude staff at all. Are we talking about the same hotel? Breakfast: big variety of choice but I did not like it that much, coffee was horrible and the water for the tea was warm, not boiling hot. Fruit juice not recommandable either. The only thing I liked was the emmenthaler cheese!! So we had our breakfast twice just outside the hotel, turn left, in front of some stairs. The Bar: not very interesting, you might as well go elswhere. In the via Veneto are several restaurants and coffee places. Don't go to ristorante Barberini in the Via della Purificazione, what a disaster! It is behind the hotel. I would book this hotel again, definitely, although next time I would rather be near the Pantheon, the historical center. If you would not like your room I am sure that staff will do anything to give you another room!

Reviews.Title: “CAN DO BETTER”
Reviews.Author: Spurwing
Reviews.Content: We were wanting a good 4 star hotel for 4 nights in Rome. This hotel was selected as it was on British Airways recommended list. We did not do any further homework on checking out the hotel which was a mistake. The good points of the Hotel: excellent location which is important in Rome because traffic and subway are poor therefore on foot is the way to see most things. Good street restaurant (outside on pavement in glass covering). Staff were friendly. Bad points: hotel is old -bedrooms are either street facing and noisy or back facing onto an internal courtyard. Bedrooms are smallish, unexciting decor and tired. Breakfast dining room is a pleasant room but breakfast is poor -watered down juice, no muesli, only tinned cubed fruit, only hot food was lumpy scrambled egg.

Reviews.Title: “A complete waste of time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at many hotels in Italy, and elsewhere in both the Americas and Europe. The Imperiale is nothing short of a complete disaster. While it can be said that hospitality is not that good in Italy, the service at the Imperiale ranks as the worst in the country. They were rude, and not only did they lie about having a "technician" come to check our air conditioning which never worked properly in the 3 nights we were there, they overcharged us on a few things. There was mold on the ceiling in the shower, which was totally disgusting. The only positive points were the reasonably decent breakfast, the tourist-centric location, and the relatively large size of the room. In hindsight, the Hotel Gambrinus is a far better hotel at a better price, and is only a short walk away. In short, stay away from this hotel at all costs. Unfortunately, I didn't pay enough careful attention to the negative comments posted on tripadvisor. I consider it an expensive lesson and only hope not to make the same mistake again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - overall really nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Of course this hotel is older, but extremely nice. The rooms were not huge, but clean, the beds very comfortable and the bath nice, as well. The hotel was quiet and the traffic not too noticeable. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast good, as well. It is very close to the Barbarini Metro stop which made getting around Rome a snap! Plus, the restaurants along Via Veneto are great! You can walk to the Borghese Gallery and Spanish Steps with no trouble. I would definitely stay in the hotel again if I wanted to stay in that area of Rome and need access to the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Waldstein
Reviews.Content: We had a room for four people and we got two bedrooms and one bath. The room was very nice. The aircondition could have been colder. The Hotel had a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “We Had A Great Time...”
Reviews.Author: AnneAlice
Reviews.Content: We had a three day break at the Imperiale in June. After reading some of the negative reviews we were a little apprehensive about having booked this hotel. However we needn't have worried - we could not fault it. We found the staff very polite and helpful, the room was clean and very comfortable (ours overlooked the lovely Via Veneto and was not at all noisy), the hotel was very convenient - within walking distance of Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc. and also near the metro. All in all we really loved our stay in Rome and would definitely stay at the Imperiale again. Highly recommended!.

Reviews.Title: “bad air conditioning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Imperiale is a 4 star hotel with 1 star A/C. With temperatures in the upper 90's, our room, 323, was too hot to sleep in, even with the windows opened all night. The hotel staff was no help on this point and asked us "what we wanted them to do". It seems that the A/C is on low and the fan won't go above one, so the system can never actually generate enough cold air to cool down the room. It seems like the A/C is off at night as well. We would not recommend this hotel in warm Roman months.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights never having been to Rome before. The hotel was pleasant and comfortable and the staff helpful and friendly (ever more so to my elderly mother who did not understand a word of Italian). A very good location for sightseeing. Not being crossed off our list for a return visit - which is rare as we do not go to many hotels twice.

Reviews.Title: “Relax in the Jacuzzi tub at the Hotel Imperiale”
Reviews.Author: pital16
Reviews.Content: After a 15 day trip through Italy, my husband and I spent our last day at the Hotel Imperiale on Via Veneto (which I think is the best street to stay on when visiting Rome). What a fantastic way to end our trip! We had tried to get into the Hotel Mascagni (we had previously spent 5 nights there a few weeks earlier), but they could not accomodate us. I usually do not book a hotel without extensive research, but ended up booking the Imperiale through an online search engine the day before when I was desperate for a room -- what a wonderful suprise! Our room was very large, with a king size bed, separate sitting area, mini bar - and the best feature, a jacuzzi tub that fit 2 people! After 15 days driving through the countryside, this was such a welcome extra surpise. The room was very clean, the Via Veneto is a quiet street, the rooms are sound-proofed anyway, the front desk staff were very accomodating and the breakfast buffet was one of the best we had all through Italy. We go to Italy almost every year, and spend a few days in Rome -- next time, we will definitley stay at the Imperiale! I can't say enough for such an affordable hotel in the best location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: classfactory
Reviews.Content: Sent here after being bumped from Hotel Mascagni last week. A bit nervous having seen other TripAdvisor reviews about this hotel, but absolutely no need to worry as it turned out. Room 312 was easily large enough for 2 adults and 2 children (large double bed + single bed + couch bed), and the kids loved the jacuzzi bath. All the important stuff is there: Brilliant location, clean and spacious room, helpful reception staff, reasonable breakfast OK, minor stuff covered elsewhere stops it getting 5 blobs (street noise, A/C, watery 'juice', lack of staff at breakfast), but don't let it put you off - overall highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Imperiale has brilliant location and friendly staff. Room 117 was another story. It was too small for two adults; the lights could not be controlled normally; there were 4 drawers, as in a night stand (15 x 19 inches each) for storage (we were staying six nights); there was only one surface to place things (21 x 42 inxches); the door from the foyer to the room swung shut, so it had to be propped with a cardboard wedge to keep it open; the door to the bathroom struck the toilet, hence it could not open fully and we had to enter/exit the bathroom sideways. The buffet breakfast beverages consisted of pale, watery sweet liquids that I supposewere asubstitutes for fruit juice; no fresh fruit, no one in sight to help. Also, since the room faced a shaft (which was not a problem for us, since it afforded silence) and it had only one window, it was stuffy and the air conditioning was turned off for the season. Of course, the other 94 rooms may be gorgeous, comfortable, and all one could ask for. I speak only for the room I was assigned.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely hated my experience with Hotel Imperiale”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a terrible experience with this hotel. The management was rude and unresponsive. They have no sense whatsoever of customer serivce. Beyond that, the hotel is not even nice. Definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience - No air conditioning after 11 p.m.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked Hotel Imperiale for the last day of my honey moon trip, because I did want a pleasant stay without bad surprises for this last day in Europe. We have stayed in wonderful Hotels in Italy and in France, which were cheaper and much more charmy and confortable than Hotel Imperiale. Okay, the Hotel has a good location and part of the staff was really nice, but the major problem is that the room in which we stayed was incredibly small (Much Smaller than the average Hotels in Europe) and HOT and when I called the reception to complain about the air conditioning, they told me that the Hotel TURNS OFF the system from 11 p.m until 7 a.m.. (EVERY NIGHT!!) The fact is that it would not be such a great problem if the temperature was below 95ºF outside and more than 110ºF inside the rooms. Another bad thing is that they keep the reception A/C system on, so that the new guests can think that the Hotel is pleasant, but, belive-me, IT REALLY IS NOT!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel. Very well located, 50 steps from the Piazza Barberini Metro stop and walking distance to the Trevi Fountain and the Stanish Steps. Big rooms, modern bathrooms (with a jacuzzi !) and a very helpful staff. Nice breakfast buffet. The two negatives that I would mention are the sound proofing of the rooms is not great (could hear conversations from the rrom next door) and the fact that air conditioning was off - apparently its central with no control by the guests. They switch it off in the winter and spring.. Overall, I would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel - as far as I am concerned, it's a five-star hotel. Clean rooms, everything new, jacuzzi, great. Excellent location - walking distance from many attractions, and right on the entrance to the metro. We will surely try to book this hotel next time in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed also in Room 420. It was our honeymoon and I thought the hotel was delightful. The room was private off the roof. Yes, there was noise from the elevator, but not too loud. We found the staff extremely helpful. The breakfast buffet was nice. The hotel is well decorated. The room also came with a great view off the private patio. We absolutely loved it. I think some people's bad reviews came from high expectations. The building this hotel is in is hundreds of years old. You cannot expect an American "Holiday Inn" experience out of it. We found it quaint and comfortable. The location is on Via Veneto and is unrivaled. Head to the cafe on the corner for fabulous hot chocolate. The Gazebo restaurant owned by the hotel is also great. As are most of the restaurants on that street. Hope this has been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “only 2 stars worth”
Reviews.Author: salubalu
Reviews.Content: we got room 420, 4th floor, rear. it was very small and the bathroom was full with mould fungus. near by the room was the machineryroom of the elevator, that was very loud. the room wasn?t cleaned the 5 days we spent. everywhere was dust.anything of the breakfastbuffet was al the time over, onetime the eggs for about 20 min, other time, the yoghurt, next, the juice or anything else. this hotel is only 2 stars worth, because only the place at via veneto is ok. i could not prever this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Taste the Via Veneto”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: In December my wife and I celebrated our wedding anniversary at the 4* Imperiale. The hotel was fine but its position on the Via Veneto is excellent for exploring Rome on foot. Close enough to all the major attractions by day and the centre of chic night life. Superb short break.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Imperiale
HotelInfo.Address: Via Vittorio Veneto 24, 00185 Rome, Italy
